page.title: 20CARNIVAL IN WOODINGDEAN 1985
page.content: The carnival takes place every year and stops on the backfield of Woodingdean First School.There are about 70 stalls including games,competitions and stalls that you can buy things from.The Mayor of Brighton attends every year and helps judge the competitions.Two bands play for the carnival.They were T.S Valiant and the Sussex Legionaires.Different games are played.For example see how many pegs you can get on one hand,beat the goalie and make the fireman wet.In the first one you have to see how many pegs you can get on one hand.The next one you have to kick a football past the goalie.Finally if you hit a target a bucket of water falls on to the fireman.Afterwards there is an underwater disco in the swimming pool.
